original: Carle, Bengt Magnus Olson-, stadsombudsman, Norrköping, f. 20/2/07 i Lund av prof. Emil Olson o. Clara Engström. G. 36 m. Eva Danelius. Barn: Ann-Sofie f. 37, Magnus 40. — Stud:ex. v. Lunds h. a. 1. 25, jur. kand. i Lund 30. Tingstjg. i Torna o. Bara häriadts doras. 30-34, amsit. i kiammiarkoM’. m. til|lf, ’tjg. i fångv:slyr. o. byggn:–styr. 35-37, bitr. stadsomb :man i Norrköp. 37, drätsels-ekr. där 38 o. stadsomb :man sed. 44, sekr. i civ:-försv:nd (luftsk :nd) sed. 38 samt i i ’Styr. f. Norrköp. stads slakthus s^ed. 44. Fd. ordf. i itax:nd, nu led. där, fd. bitr. ’sekr. i Jöne- o. pens :nd, fd. ’sekr. o. isikattm. i Norrlköp. itj :m :isiäill<sik. Resia t. Finl. 46. Skr.: art i Sv. Stadsförb. Tidskir. om Skiärpita åtgärdeir f. im-drivn. av k o mm :utsikylder. Hobby: bridge. RLSFSM 45.
translated: Carle, Bengt Magnus Olson- was a city official in Norrköping, born on February 20th, 1907 in Lund to Professor Emil Olson and Clara Engström. He married Eva Danelius in 1936, and they had two children: Ann-Sofie, born in 1937, and Magnus, born in 1940. He graduated from Lund's high school in 1925 and obtained a law degree from Lund University in 1930. He was a judicial clerk in Torna and Bara from 1930 to 1934 and subsequently an assistant in the Kammarkollegiet. He served in the prison and construction management departments from 1935 to 1937, before becoming an assistant city official in Norrköping in 1937. He was appointed city treasurer in 1938 and city official in 1944. He was also secretary of the civil defence (air defence) committee since 1938 and of the board of directors for Norrköping's city abbatoir since 1944. He was a former chairman and current member of the tax committee, a former assistant secretary of the Jöne- and Pens committee, and a former secretary and chief accountant for Norrköping's welfare committee. He travelled to Finland in 1946. He wrote an article in the Swedish Association of Cities' journal on measures for the enforcement of commissary judgments. His hobby was bridge, and he was awarded the Royal Swedish Bridge Federation's gold medal in 1945.
